description: Major events from the Roman Republic and Empire

events.name: Foundation of Rome
events.description: Legendary founding of Rome by Romulus, marking the beginning of Roman civilization

events.name: Establishment of the Roman Republic
events.description: Overthrow of the last Roman king and establishment of the Roman Republic with consular government

events.name: Caesar Crosses the Rubicon
events.description: Julius Caesar crosses the Rubicon river with his army, beginning the Roman Civil War and end of the Republic

events.name: Assassination of Julius Caesar
events.description: Julius Caesar assassinated on the Ides of March in the Roman Senate, leading to further civil wars

events.name: Battle of Actium
events.description: Naval battle where Octavian defeated Mark Antony and Cleopatra, leading to the end of the Roman Republic

events.name: Augustus Becomes First Emperor
events.description: Octavian becomes Augustus, the first Roman Emperor, marking the beginning of the Roman Empire

events.name: Great Fire of Rome
events.description: Devastating fire that burned for six days and seven nights, destroying much of Rome during Nero's reign

events.name: Construction of the Colosseum Completed
events.description: Completion of the Flavian Amphitheatre (Colosseum), the largest amphitheatre ever built

events.name: Constantine's Victory at Milvian Bridge
events.description: Constantine defeats Maxentius at the Battle of Milvian Bridge, becoming sole emperor and later converting to Christianity

events.name: Fall of the Western Roman Empire
events.description: Deposition of Romulus Augustulus, marking the traditional end of the Western Roman Empire
